Package es.urjc.etsii.grafo.PSSC.model.neigh

Class SwapAndDropNeighborhood

java.lang.Object
es.urjc.etsii.grafo.solution.neighborhood.Neighborhood<SwapAndDropNeighborhood.SwapAndDropMove,PSSCSolution,PSSCInstance>
es.urjc.etsii.grafo.PSSC.model.neigh.SwapAndDropNeighborhood
public class SwapAndDropNeighborhood extends es.urjc.etsii.grafo.solution.neighborhood.Neighborhood<SwapAndDropNeighborhood.SwapAndDropMove,PSSCSolution,PSSCInstance>
A powerful composite neighborhood that explores a (1,1)-Swap followed immediately by a Drop. This move is designed to find strictly improving paths that simple Drop or Swap moves cannot. This version includes critical performance optimizations to make it viable for large instances. A SwapAndDrop move consists of: 1. Swapping one set 'setOut' (from the solution) with 'setIn' (not in the solution). 2. After the swap, checking if any other set 'setDrop' in the solution has become redundant. This entire sequence constitutes a single move with a score change of -1.

  • Constructor Details

    • SwapAndDropNeighborhood

      public SwapAndDropNeighborhood(int candidateListSize)
      Constructor for the optimized SwapAndDropNeighborhood.
      Parameters:
      candidateListSize - The number of promising 'in' candidates to consider for each 'out' set. A smaller value is faster but less thorough. 50 is a good starting point.

    • SwapAndDropNeighborhood

      public SwapAndDropNeighborhood()
      Default constructor uses a candidate list size of 50.
